a: James Sirius, Albus Severus and Lily Luna

q: Where does Rubeus Hagrid first tell Harry that he’s a wizard?

q: Who discovered the 12 uses for dragon blood?

How many presents did Dudley Dursley receive on his birthday in total?
a: 38. It was 36 (one less than last year), but then Mrs. Dursley bought him two new presents to make up for it.

q: What was the Fat Lady’s password to get into the Gryffindor common room?
What is the first line of the book?
a: Mr. and Mrs. Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much.

a: In Madame Malkin’s Robes for All Occasions

q: What do Uncle Vernon and Aunt Petunia give Harry for Christmas?

a: The Bodleian Library at Oxford University

q: In the movie, Professor McGonagall explains the origins of the Chamber of Secrets. Who does it in the book?
a: Professor Binns, the history teacher (who is also a ghost)

q: Why does Neville Longbottom faint in Herbology class?
a: His earmuffs were loose, so he heard the cry of the baby mandrake.

q: Why do Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger stop speaking?
a: Ron blames Hermione’s cat, Crookshanks, for the disappearance of his pet rat, Scabbers.

What is Parvati Patil’s Boggart in the book and the movie?

q: And how does Parvati defeat it?
a: In the book, the mummy trips on its wrappings. In the movie, it turns into a giant jack-in-the-box (arguably no less scary).

q: At the beginning of the story, where does Hedwig find Harry?
a: She is waiting in his room at the Leaky Cauldron. Clever owl!

q: True or false: This is the longest movie in the franchise.
